ribiosIO 1.0-68
  • Reference

    Column bind (cbind) two GctMatrix objects

    cbindGct.Rd

    Column bind (cbind) two GctMatrix objects

    cbindGct(
  gctMatrix1,
  gctMatrix2,
  feature = c("union", "intersection"),
  missingValue = 0
)

    Arguments

    gctMatrix1

    The first object

    gctMatrix2

    The second object

    feature

    What happens if the set of the features in both objects differ? Either union or intersection is possible.

    missingValue

    Missing values, NA or numeric values (such as 0) are accepted

    Value

    A larger matrix, with gctMatrix1 on the left and gctMatrix2 on the right, with merged features and descriptions.

    Examples

    m1 <- matrix(1:6, nrow=3, dimnames=list(sprintf("G%d", 1:3), sprintf("S%d", 1:2)))
m2 <- matrix(c(9:7, 12:10), nrow=3, dimnames=list(sprintf("G%d", 3:1), sprintf("S%d", 3:4)))
gm1 <- GctMatrix(m1, desc=sprintf("Gene%d", 1:3))
gm2 <- GctMatrix(m2, desc=sprintf("Gene%d", 3:1))
gm1
#> A GctMatrix with 3 features and 2 samples.
#> -- Below are the first rows and columns, use `showAll=TRUE` to print all values
#>    S1 S2
#> G1  1  4
#> G2  2  5
#> G3  3  6
#> First feature descriptions: Gene1,Gene2,Gene3 
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
gm2
#> A GctMatrix with 3 features and 2 samples.
#> -- Below are the first rows and columns, use `showAll=TRUE` to print all values
#>    S3 S4
#> G3  9 12
#> G2  8 11
#> G1  7 10
#> First feature descriptions: Gene3,Gene2,Gene1 
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
gm12 <- cbindGct(gm1, gm2)
gm12
#> A GctMatrix with 3 features and 4 samples.
#> -- Below are the first rows and columns, use `showAll=TRUE` to print all values
#>    S1 S2 S3 S4
#> G1  1  4  7 10
#> G2  2  5  8 11
#> G3  3  6  9 12
#> First feature descriptions: Gene1,Gene2,Gene3 
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
m3 <- matrix(13:18, nrow=3, dimnames=list(sprintf("G%d", 2:4), sprintf("S%d", 5:6)))
gm3 <- GctMatrix(m3, desc=sprintf("Gene%d", 2:4))
gm3
#> A GctMatrix with 3 features and 2 samples.
#> -- Below are the first rows and columns, use `showAll=TRUE` to print all values
#>    S5 S6
#> G2 13 16
#> G3 14 17
#> G4 15 18
#> First feature descriptions: Gene2,Gene3,Gene4 
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
gm123Intersect <- cbindGct(gm12, gm3, feature="intersect")
print(gm123Intersect, showAll=TRUE)
#> A GctMatrix with 2 features and 6 samples.
#>    S1 S2 S3 S4 S5 S6
#> G2  2  5  8 11 13 16
#> G3  3  6  9 12 14 17
#> attr(,"desc")
#> [1] "Gene2" "Gene3"
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "GctMatrix" "matrix"   
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
gm123Union <- cbindGct(gm12, gm3, feature="union")
print(gm123Union, showAll=TRUE)
#> A GctMatrix with 4 features and 6 samples.
#>    S1 S2 S3 S4 S5 S6
#> G1  1  4  7 10  0  0
#> G2  2  5  8 11 13 16
#> G3  3  6  9 12 14 17
#> G4  0  0  0  0 15 18
#> attr(,"desc")
#> [1] "Gene1" "Gene2" "Gene3" "Gene4"
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "GctMatrix" "matrix"   
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
gm123UnionNA <- cbindGct(gm12, gm3, feature="union", missingValue = NA)
print(gm123UnionNA)
#> A GctMatrix with 4 features and 6 samples.
#> -- Below are the first rows and columns, use `showAll=TRUE` to print all values
#>    S1 S2 S3 S4 S5 ...
#> G1  1  4  7 10 NA ...
#> G2  2  5  8 11 13 ...
#> G3  3  6  9 12 14 ...
#> G4 NA NA NA NA 15 ...
#> First feature descriptions: Gene1,Gene2,Gene3,Gene4 
#> -- Use `gctDesc` to fetch feature descriptions
#> -- Use `rownames` and `colnames` to fetch row and column names
#> -- All methods applicable to matrix can be used
